column1: The Purple Pig////This place was so good I had tears in my eyes. I would highly recommend the bone marrow
column5: and the scallops. Each dish was amazing and showed astounding culinary talent; as a home chef I was amazed. The bone marrow was a perfect combination of grease
column9: and salt. The broccoli was so suprisingly good and the scallops did not disappoint. The milk braised pork shoulder was the star of the night: the melt in your mouth meat combined perfectly with the mashed potatoes. The smoked pork tongue was good
column10: and so was the lamb. You could tell the meat was very high quality. Overall
column12: but the price tags are something to be careful of.
